entry.title: SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT, Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 4:39 a.m. ADT Monday 8 May 2023

entry.title: Monday: Flurries. High plus 2.
entry.summary: Flurries ending this afternoon then cloudy. Amount 2 cm. Wind becoming northeast 20 km/h near noon. High plus 2. Wind chill minus 7 this morning. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 6:00 AM NDT Monday 8 May 2023

entry.title: Monday night: Chance of flurries. Low minus 1. POP 40%
entry.summary: Cloudy. 40 percent chance of flurries this evening. Snow beginning near midnight. Amount 5 cm. Wind northeast 20 km/h becoming north 30 gusting to 50 this evening. Low minus 1. Wind chill minus 10 overnight. Forecast issued 6:00 AM NDT Monday 8 May 2023
